results.title: Romance calling: the forgotten city
results.brief_description: Film tells of the discovery of Angkor Thom, “the forbidden city” in Indo China and of its previous civilisation, showing ruins of this now extinct city.

results.title: Shearing time at Billabong
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Australia’s 120 million sheep are scattered all over the continent wherever there is green grass and water. Billabong Station, in the hot dry interior, depends upon a nearby billabong to supply water to moisten the fertile soil. On the station property 40,000 sheep graze and each summer, shearing at Billabong commences. Gangs of shearers travel from far and wide to work at Billabong. The sheep are mustered by men and their dogs, sent through the drafting yards and into the shearing shed. The wool taken from the shearers is skirted, sorted, and pressed into 300-lb bales - and sent on its way to the sales. After that, Australia’s wool goes to the world.

results.title: Victoria's Energy
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Victoria’s energy” uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

See also Related Title “Energy conservation in the home” which provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

results.title: Living with forests
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Stephen Skok and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Living with forests: The future of Leadbeater’s forest is the subject of a local enquiry. The viewer is asked to imagine that you are a member of the local community and give your views.

results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Giorgio Mangiamele, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.

results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, Lee Gordon Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

In March 1983 Focus spent one week in the Northern Territory looking at the living conditions of First Nations people in the most famous small town in Australia, Alice Springs. Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby.

results.title: Get wet
results.creator_credit: Image East and Royal Life Saving Society
results.brief_description: The message of this humorous program featuring Jonathon Coleman is that water can be great fun providing you know how to enjoy it safely. Presents a number of typical scenarios - swimming pool, river and beach.
